data.title: More Women Accuse James Toback of Sexual Harassment
data.meta_description: More than 300 women have reportedly accused the director of harassment or abuse, including Julianne Moore, Selma Blair and Rachel McAdams.
data.text:
In the days after more than 30 women alleged that the movie director James Toback had sexually harassed or assaulted them, hundreds more have reportedly made similar accusations.

Among those who went public this week were the actors Julianne Moore, Selma Blair and Rachel McAdams.

On Sunday, The Los Angeles Times reported that 38 women had accused Mr. Toback, a director and screenwriter who worked on movies including “Bugsy” and “Two Girls and a Guy,” of harassment.

The women’s stories were similar. They included allegations that Mr. Toback tried to impress them by talking about his work and, in many cases, invited them to hotel rooms where he told them to take off their clothes.

Some of the women accused Mr. Toback, 72, of rubbing his groin against them or masturbating while forcing them to look him in the eye.

Glenn Whipp, who wrote Sunday’s article for The Times, reported on Monday that hundreds of women were reaching out to the newspaper with new allegations. He added that their stories were unverified.
